definition: to wish/to want/ready/willing (to do sth)
honest/prudent/variant of 願|愿[yuan4]
to hope/to wish/to desire/hoped-for/ready/willing
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
idea/meaning/thought/to think/wish/desire/intention/to expect/to anticipate

sentences.english: Your willingness to sacrifice countless late nights consoling them?
sentences.chinese: 或者是因为你愿意花费无数的夜晚去安慰他们？

sentences.english: I consent to take any pre-employment physical examination required by the Company.
sentences.chinese: 本人愿意接受公司要求的职前体格检查。

sentences.english: Think about what are people willing to pay for, says Ms. Dunningham.
sentences.chinese: “想想人们愿意出钱做的工作，”坎宁安说。“

sentences.english: Commitment to animal welfare issues and to promoting IFAW's mission.
sentences.chinese: 理解动物福利理念，并愿意推动IFAW宗旨。

sentences.english: Are you willing to return, escorted by me?
sentences.chinese: 你愿意回去吗，由我来护送？

sentences.english: Yes, I would like to help you carry these bags.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我愿意帮你拿一下这些包。

sentences.english: He had offered the loan of his small villa at Cap Ferrat.
sentences.chinese: 他愿意借出在费拉角的小别墅。

sentences.english: While reluctant to criticize the status quo, the guides often let things slip out in conversation.
sentences.chinese: 导游不愿意批评现状，但在交谈中会不时漏嘴。

sentences.english: Would you rather live in a country with no unemployment?
sentences.chinese: 你愿意生活在一个没有失业的国家吗？

sentences.english: It is the customer's responsibility to close out hedges if they wish to do so.
sentences.chinese: 这是客户的责任来将锁单平仓，如果他们愿意这么做。

sentences.english: But I will no longer importune my young cousin.
sentences.chinese: 可是我也不愿意委曲我那年轻的表妹。

sentences.english: With the oil prices up, people would rather to use E-bike.
sentences.chinese: 随着石油价格的上涨，人们更加愿意使用电单车。

sentences.english: Which one would you like first?
He CNNs his old friends for not lending money to him.
sentences.chinese: 老朋友们因为不愿意借钱给他而遭到他无耻地辱骂。

sentences.english: With softness and strength, i would like to make more friends.
sentences.chinese: 我刚柔并济，活泼大方，愿意结交更多的朋友。

sentences.english: But they are willing to teach even though they're not getting paid what they should get paid.
sentences.chinese: 他们还是愿意去教，虽然他们并没得到应得的报酬。

definition: to be willing to do sth/to be ready to do sth/to be happy to do sth/content/satisfied
would rather/better
old variant of 肯[ken3]
to agree/to consent/to be ready (to do sth)/willing
unwilling/unwillingness
to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)
delighted to (do sth, idiom)/perfectly happy to do/most willing to do
willing (to do sth)/to take pleasure in
unexpectedly
to take up time/to spend time
to be willing to part with sth
preferably/one would prefer to...(or not to...)/would rather/(would) be better to/(to pick) the lesser of two evils
to balance an account/accountancy/accounting
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
to dare/daring/(polite) may I venture
would rather.../it would be better.../would prefer
improbable/unlikely/will not (act, happen etc)/not able/not having learned to do sth/(coll.) (Tw) don't mention it/not at all
to refuse/to decline/to reject
